title: SYLAS ULTIMATE CONFUSION
body: So, i was just thinking what will happen if SYLAS try to steal enemy SYLAS's ULTIMATE?

replies.body:
If enemy sylas hasn't stolen an ult, nothing.
If enemy sylas has stolen an ult, you steal that ult.
Sylas ultimate works when enemy champ have ultimate at that time.. will it steal the enemy ult stolen ultimate or sylas's own ultimate.

I'm not entirely sure I understand what you're asking. I would recommend watching this video at the 3 minute mark as I think it will clear things up. 
https://youtu.be/IfAaBLO3CsQ?t=179
You steal the ult enemy sylas has stolen. If enemy sylas hasn't stolen any ults, you can't steal anything from him. For example if enemy sylas steals tryndamere's ult, if you ult the enemy sylas, you'll get tryndamere's ult.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uc43GY27,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-11T14:46:35.087+0000)
>
> I'd say he can then use a Sylas ult.
